article_title: Candidates are skipping traditionally mighty farm issues in Iowa
article_text:
Ideology trumps farming issues in the run-up to Iowa’s presidential caucuses

The state’s oversized role in steering national farm policy could wane as the campaign focuses on other issues

The discussion of ethanol policy puts conservatives in an awkward spot

article_metadata.news-keywords: Iowa, presidential, caucus, farming, agriculture, Donald Trump, Ted Cruz, Ben Carson, ethanol, corn, renewable fuel
article_metadata.description: The presidential campaign’s focus on issues such as immigration and foreign affairs means candidates spend far less time talking about agriculture — even as they near the first-in-the-nation caucuses in farm state Iowa.
article_metadata.title: Candidates are skipping traditionally mighty farm issues in Iowa | The Kansas City Star
